item.title: Meatballs
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 medium onion
  • 3 garlic cloves
  • Fresh parsley (small bunch)

Pantry

  • Breadcrumbs
  • Tinned chopped tomatoes
  • Tomato paste
  • Olive oil

Spices

  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Dried oregano
  • Paprika

Proteins

  • 500g beef mince (10–12% fat)

Other

  • 1 egg
  • Parmesan cheese (optional but recommended)

Utensils List

  • Large mixing bowl
  • Frying pan or sauté pan
  • Baking tray (optional)
  • Wooden spoon
  • Knife & chopping board

Ingredients (4 servings)

  • 500g beef mince
  • 1 medium onion, finely diced
  • 3 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1 egg
  • 40g breadcrumbs
  • 2 tbsp chopped fresh parsley
  • 1 tsp dried oregano
  • 1/2 tsp paprika
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1/2 tsp black pepper
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • For the sauce:
    • 1 can (400g) chopped tomatoes
    • 1 tbsp tomato paste
    • Salt & pepper to taste

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Finely dice the onion and mince the garlic.
  2. Combine mince, onion, garlic, egg, breadcrumbs, parsley, oregano, paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
  3. Mix gently until just combined (do not overwork).
  4. Roll into 12–16 meatballs.

Cooking Instructions

Option 1 — Pan-fried (most flavourful)

  1. Heat olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
  2. Brown the meatballs on all sides (about 6–8 minutes).
  3. Remove excess oil if needed.
  4. Add chopped tomatoes and tomato paste.
  5. Simmer for 20 minutes until sauce thickens and meatballs are cooked through.

Option 2 — Oven-baked

  1. Preheat oven to 200°C.
  2. Place meatballs on a lined baking tray.
  3. Bake 18–20 minutes until browned.
  4. Transfer to a saucepan with tomatoes + tomato paste, and simmer 10 minutes.

Storage & Reheating Instructions

  • Fridge: Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
  • Freezer: Freeze meatballs with sauce for up to 3 months.
  • Reheat: Microwave 2–3 minutes or simmer on the hob until hot throughout.

item.title: Garlic Pasta
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • Garlic (6–8 cloves)
  • Fresh parsley (small bunch)
  • Lemon (1, optional)

Pantry

  • Spaghetti or linguine (250g)
  • Olive oil
  • Unsalted butter
  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Grated Parmesan or Pecorino

Spices

  • Chilli flakes (optional)

Proteins

  • None (vegetarian)

Other

  • Pasta cooking water (reserved)

Utensils List

  • Large pot
  • Large frying pan or sauté pan
  • Knife and chopping board
  • Tongs or pasta fork
  • Microplane grater (optional)

Ingredients (2 servings)

  • 250g spaghetti or linguine
  • 6–8 garlic cloves, thinly sliced
  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tbsp butter
  • 1 tsp chilli flakes (optional)
  • Small handful parsley, finely chopped
  • 20–30g Parmesan, grated
  • Salt & black pepper to taste
  • 60–120 ml pasta water (as needed)
  • Optional: zest of ½ lemon

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Slice the garlic very thinly.
  2. Chop the parsley.
  3. Grate the cheese.
  4. Zest the lemon if using.
  5. Bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil.

Cooking Instructions

  1. Cook the pasta:
    Add spaghetti to the boiling salted water and cook until just shy of al dente. Reserve a mug of pasta water.
